main event: An observation of an unidentified flying object at Pope AFB, N.C. on 10th July 1958, which appeared to be changing course and heading north at a rapid speed.
interesting points: The object sighted was at an altitude of 5,000 to 6,000 feet and was observed for approximately 35 miles before changing its course around a bend in the mountains.
The report mentions that the object faded to the southeast, indicating a change in direction before disappearing.
The observation lasted for 22 minutes, providing a substantial timeframe for the sighting.
The pilot of the 60-52 TAKHEE reported seeing strange lights in his cockpit while on the final approach of a GCA run, adding credibility to the observation.
The UFO was considered a hazard to aircraft operating in the area, as indicated by the pilot's report and the observation made by tower personnel.
witnesses: air traffic controller, wing intelligence officer, pilot
